text: Justine Lerond (born 29 February 2000) is a French professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for Metz. ==Career== A youth academy graduate of Metz, Lerond made her senior team debut on 31 January 2016, in a Coupe de France match against Yzeure. She made her league debut on 11 September 2016 against Montpellier. Lerond is a French youth international and was part of the France under-19 squad which won 2019 UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship. Her good performances throughout the tournament earned her a spot in team of the tournament announced by UEFA. She was also part of France under-20 side which reached semi-finals of 2018 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup. ==Honours== ===Club=== ;Metz *Division 2 Féminine: 2017–18 ===International=== ;France U19 *UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship: 2019 ===Individual=== *UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship - Team of the Tournament: 2019 ==References== Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:People from Metz Category:French women's footballers Category:FC Metz (women) players Category:Women's association football goalkeepers
title: Justine Lerond
